intro: Braya kokonorica, commonly known as the Tibetan rock-braya, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and adjacent areas. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Braya kokonorica is often found in alpine meadows and is a rare species with limited distribution.
